story.iWant: to plan and supervise multi-call learning arcs
story.soThat: callers experience coherent progress across conversations

context.applies: Before and after each call to maintain session continuity
assumptions: Callers have multiple interactions over time
Each call should build on previous progress
Session planning should balance goals, curriculum, and caller state

acceptanceCriteria.title: Session Context Assembly
acceptanceCriteria.then: Relevant context from previous calls is assembled for the agent

acceptanceCriteria.title: Session Goal Setting
acceptanceCriteria.given: Caller has active goals and curriculum position
acceptanceCriteria.then: Appropriate session goals are identified and prioritized

acceptanceCriteria.title: Continuity Maintenance
acceptanceCriteria.then: Unfinished threads are flagged for potential continuation

acceptanceCriteria.title: Arc Progress Validation
acceptanceCriteria.given: Caller is in a multi-call learning arc
acceptanceCriteria.then: Arc progress is validated and next steps are recommended

acceptanceCriteria.title: Pacing Supervision
acceptanceCriteria.then: Pacing is evaluated against optimal learning curves

acceptanceCriteria.title: Session Closure Quality
acceptanceCriteria.then: Session closure is evaluated for proper wrap-up and setup for next call

parameters.name: Context Relevance Score
parameters.description: How relevant the assembled context is to the likely direction of this session

scoringAnchors.example: Context includes: recent goal progress, last call's unfinished topic, personality-based style guidance, and relevant memories
Context includes caller's active goals and last call summary
Context only includes basic caller profile
Caller treated as new with no history context

promptGuidance.whenHigh: Context assembly is strong - agent is well-prepared for continuity.
promptGuidance.whenLow: Context assembly is weak - may need to ask caller about recent progress.

parameters.name: Session Goal Quality
parameters.description: Quality of the goals identified for this specific session

interpretationScale.label: Excellent Goals
interpretationScale.implication: Clear, achievable, aligned with caller priorities

scoringAnchors.example: Session goals: (1) Review last session's concept application, (2) Introduce next curriculum module, (3) Address caller's specific question from last call
Session goals: Continue curriculum progress and check in on goals
Session goal: Have a good conversation
No session goals identified

promptGuidance.whenHigh: Session goals are clear - agent can work toward specific outcomes.
promptGuidance.whenLow: Session goals are vague - session may lack direction.

parameters.name: Continuity Score
parameters.description: How well the session maintains continuity with previous interactions

scoringAnchors.example: Agent references: specific thing caller said last time, progress made, and picks up exactly where they left off
Agent acknowledges previous call and asks about progress since then
Agent makes generic 'welcome back' without specific references
Agent treats caller as if first interaction, asks already-known information

promptGuidance.whenHigh: Continuity is strong - caller feels known and progress is tracked.
promptGuidance.whenLow: Continuity is weak - consider referencing previous interactions more explicitly.

scoringAnchors.example: Caller has completed 4 of 5 modules in the arc, mastery demonstrated
Caller is competent in 2 modules, working on third
Caller just finished introduction module
Caller hasn't started the learning arc yet

promptGuidance.whenHigh: Arc nearly complete - plan for arc conclusion and next arc introduction.
promptGuidance.whenLow: Arc just starting - focus on foundation building and motivation.

parameters.name: Pacing Alignment
parameters.description: How well the actual pacing matches optimal learning curves

interpretationScale.label: Optimal Pacing
interpretationScale.implication: Learning rate is ideal for this caller

scoringAnchors.example: Caller is advancing at their learning velocity, retention is high, engagement is strong
Caller is keeping up with slight challenge, occasional review needed
Caller showing signs of overload or boredom (pace too fast or slow)
Caller repeatedly forgetting previous content, or disengaging due to repetition

promptGuidance.whenHigh: Pacing is well-aligned - maintain current progression rate.
promptGuidance.whenLow: Pacing is misaligned - consider speeding up or slowing down based on signals.

parameters.name: Session Closure Quality
parameters.description: Quality of session wrap-up and setup for next interaction

interpretationScale.label: Excellent Closure
interpretationScale.implication: Clear summary, next steps, and anticipation built

interpretationScale.label: Poor Closure
interpretationScale.implication: Abrupt end, no setup for next time

scoringAnchors.example: Session ended with: summary of what was covered, acknowledgment of progress, preview of next topic, and personal note
Session ended with summary and mention of what's coming next time
Session ended with 'talk to you next time' without recap
Call ended abruptly mid-topic with no closure

promptGuidance.whenHigh: Closure was strong - caller leaves with clear sense of progress and anticipation.
promptGuidance.whenLow: Closure was weak - ensure future sessions include proper wrap-up.

parameters.name: Thread Management
parameters.description: How well open conversational threads are tracked and resolved

interpretationScale.label: Excellent
interpretationScale.implication: All threads tracked and appropriately handled

scoringAnchors.example: Agent tracked 3 open threads from last call, addressed 2, explicitly tabled 1 for next time with caller agreement
Agent returned to unfinished topic from last call
Agent vaguely references 'where we left off' without specifics
Important thread from last call never mentioned again

promptGuidance.whenHigh: Thread management is strong - caller feels heard and topics are properly resolved.
promptGuidance.whenLow: Thread management is weak - review open threads and ensure follow-up.

constraints.description: Session goals should prioritize caller's explicit requests over system objectives
Balance continuity with flexibility - don't force old topics if caller has new priorities
Limit session goals to 2-3 primary objectives to avoid overload
